title: Serving Transitions From: HTTP Protocol (not secure)

profile.name: Automattic
profile.about: WordPress.com, VaultPress, Akismet, Gravatar, WooCommerce, Polldaddy, Tumblr and more!

vulnerability_information:
Dear Sir,

I've Noticed from your SourceCode that you are using HTTP Protocol, and that will makes Insecure served for data transition.

we will give the attacker a chance for "MIMT" ( man in the middle attack) as you know that the name of the attack itself explain the steps.

-check the source code of the main page.

Solution: try to use https protocol, to prevent data and information disclosure.

Best,
vulnerability_information_html:
Dear Sir,

I've Noticed from your SourceCode that you are using HTTP Protocol, and that will makes Insecure served for data transition.

we will give the attacker a chance for "MIMT" ( man in the middle attack) as you know that the name of the attack itself explain the steps.

-check the source code of the main page.

Solution: try to use https protocol, to prevent data and information disclosure.

Best,

activities.message:
Hi - 

Thanks for the report.  I am not 100% sure what you are reporting since there is no URL in your report but I suspect this is a known issue.  WordPress.com doesn't generally support SSL certificates for non WordPress.com subdomains.  We hope to add support for this in the coming months.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi -

Thanks for the report. I am not 100% sure what you are reporting since there is no URL in your report but I suspect this is a known issue. WordPress.com doesn't generally support SSL certificates for non WordPress.com subdomains. We hope to add support for this in the coming months.

activities.message:
hi,

thank you for your information, and about the URL i said in the report that you can check your Source Code, since its not important what is the specefic URL because we are talking about SSL and MIMT attack (im talking about information disclosure) it doesnt matter from any URL came those information.

BUT since SSL for non Wordpress,com doesnt supported By WordPress , so im agree with you 100%
thank you again.

activities.message:
publicly disclosed, nice :)

the main point for my request of disclosing this ( we don't need to wait wordpress until they support us by Cert!, i think you can setup your SSL, as it's not impossible! ) as i understand from you that we allow the attackers to exploit there attack until wordpress suport us!!! .. :) 

full respect for you  and your team, im glad to contact with you,

Khair Alhamad,
